wikipedia_page.main: John Rowlands (pen name, "Giraldus"; 1824 – 4 July 1891) was a Welsh antiquary and educator,  a literary man who wrote several interesting things in English and Welsh, and was an occasional contributor to the daily and weekly journals of the day.

response: *John Rowlands (author) (1938–2015), Welsh language novelist and academic
*John Rowlands (RAF officer) (1915–2006), George Cross recipient, World War II bomb disposal expert, post-war developer of British A-bomb
* John Rowlands, programmer of Mayhem in Monsterland and other video games
*4 July – John Rowlands (Giraldus), antiquary, author and teacher, 67
